arm_group.description: All study subjects will have their surplus sperm analyzed for DNA fragmentation with the SpermComet assay.

brief_summary.textblock:
We will investigate potential correlation between SpermComet DNA fragmentation assay results
      and IVF cycle outcome.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Observational Correlation of Sperm Assay Results With Blastocyst Formation

detailed_description.textblock:
A "SpermComet" assay will be used to characterize DNA fragmentation of surplus sperm samples
      remaining after in vitro fertilization (IVF) cycles.  We will investigate potential
      correlation between these assay results and the outcomes of IVF cycles that used those sperm
      samples.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Undergoing IVF

          -  Surplus sperm available after oocyte insemination

          -  Consented

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Surgical sperm extraction

          -  Use of donated sperm or oocytes

          -  No minors may participate

study_pop.textblock:
Couples who undergoing IVF treatment who have surplus sperm available after oocyte
        insemination.

intervention.description: Measurement of DNA fragmentation in samples of surplus sperm (diagnostic, not an intervention).

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Observational Correlation of Sperm Assay Results With Blastocyst Formation

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of oocytes and of fertilized oocytes that form blastocysts.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of inseminated oocytes that form exactly two pronuclei.
Grade and measurements of blastocysts that form.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
